member.name: ITfKeyEventSink.OnKeyDown
member.summary: Called when a key down event occurs.
member.param: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.
Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.
Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event was handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event was not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ITfKeyEventSink.OnKeyUp
member.summary: Called when a key up event occurs.
member.param: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.
Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.
Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event was handled. If this value receives FALSE, the key event was not handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ITfKeyEventSink.OnPreservedKey
member.summary: Called when a preserved key event occurs.
member.param: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.
Contains the command GUID of the preserved key.

Pointer to a BOOL value that, on exit, indicates if the preserved key event was handled. If this value receives TRUE, the preserved key event was handled. If this value receives FALSE, the preserved key event was not handled.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ITfKeyEventSink.OnSetFocus
member.summary: Called when a TSF text service receives or loses the keyboard focus.
member.param: If TRUE, the test service receives the focus. Otherwise the text service loses the focus.
member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ITfKeyEventSink.OnTestKeyDown
member.summary: Called to determine if a text service will handle a key down event.
member.param: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.
Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYDOWN.
Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event would be handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event would be handled. If this value is FALSE, the key event would not be handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ITfKeyEventSink.OnTestKeyUp
member.summary: Called to determine if a text service will handle a key up event.
member.param: Pointer to the input context that receives the key event.
Specifies the virtual-key code of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the wParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Specifies the repeat count, scan code, extended-key flag, context code, previous key-state flag, and transition-state flag of the key. For more information about this parameter, see the lParam parameter in WM_KEYUP.

Pointer to a BOOL that, on exit, indicates if the key event would be handled. If this value receives TRUE, the key event would be handled. If this value receives FALSE, the key event would not be handled.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ITfKeyEventSink
member.summary: The ITfKeyEventSink interface is implemented by a text service to receive keyboard and focus event notifications. To install this event sink, call .
